text: most drop cookies start by creaming
butter and sugar together but in this
case we substituted a healthier swap
with coconut oil which also adds great
flavor
and we've added some really delicious
granola mix-ins like dried cherries
coconut pepitas and of course some
chopped dark chocolate so let's get
started the coconut oil goes in first
now this is at a solid stage which
happens when it's cold which is really
best for creaming with the sugar I'm
just gonna put it right in the mixer
this is half a cup of coconut oil then
brown sugar one cup of brown sugar and
this is gonna add some great caramely
notes to the cookie start these creaming
together now it's not gonna be like when
you cream butter and sugar it's not
gonna get off fluff we we just want to
mix them together okay that looks great
so now the eggs two whole eggs drop them
in and do one at a time just to get it
incorporated okay second one I like to
stop the mixer in case I've got a bit of
eggshell in there it doesn't get mixed
in
and now one teaspoon of vanilla extract
this is pure vanilla extract okay and
then the dry ingredients a cup and a
quarter of all-purpose flour one
teaspoon of coarse salt and a half
teaspoon of baking soda for leavener and
then on low mix those together add 1/2
cup rolled oats and these are
unsweetened coconut flakes
I like this larger flake it has a really
nice texture to the cookie half a cup of
pepitas these will add color and great
texture one cup of dried cherries the
best part
I think quarter cup flax seed this is
great for health and the ground flax
seed will absorb better into your body
so definitely use the ground and then
five ounces of bittersweet chocolate
this is the delicious parts this is it
the cookie is basically done it all just
gets mixed together and then this is
going to go into the refrigerator just
to chill so that the dough can firm up
about one hour can do it but you can
also make this go ahead and just keep it
in your fridge until the next step if
you want to bake them off okay I have
mentioned oh and I have an ice cream
scoop which I love to use to scoop
cookies but you could just do a heaping
tablespoon that's about the size of
these cookies and I'm using a piece of
parchment paper on this baking sheet but
you could also use a Silpat one of those
non-stick baking mats those work really
well and these are ready to go right
into a 350 degree oven for about 13
minutes they'll be nicely golden brown
beautiful little mounds let them cool
and then they'll be ready to enjoy
so my cookies have cooled and as you can
see it makes about 3 dozen cookies they
look delicious they have a nice golden
brown on the edge in the bottom and
break them open and you can see all
those good bits inside so it's basically
a really healthy chocolate chip cookie
we've added all those delicious things
inside that are good for you and
so so good to eat so I'm gonna try
there's a crunch on the edge and they're
nice and soft inside and I love all
those bits inside so give these a try
you
